Before we stray too far into every possible strong AA build, the OP posted a charisma based arcane archer and wanted feedback on how that would work on BSK.
Anyone?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Yes Mick, sorry Mick.

I don't know whether this would be a viable option, but what about a simple Bard/ AA split? It would allow you to keep elf without xp penalty (though I seem to recall that doesn't feature in BSK), and also gives free longbow proficiency. Bard, of course, is a 3/4 BAB class, and iirc AA requires a BAB of +6, so it would need 8 levels before AA could be taken. Then you could use 3 more Bard levels for skill dumps and have 29 AA levels. Clearly, Bard would be more more singing than anything else, but maybe...?

It's only a thought atm, but I wanted to see if anyone thinks it might be worth pursuing before I spend ages doing something pointless (and no, I need no comment on that bit, thank you very much).

Crap, I've just remembered, I'd have to take 2 more of those Bard levels pre-epic, so that gives a BAB of 27 and only 1 level of Bard in epic. Still do-able, but more of a strain.

Cheers

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
The Holy elven archer is low on hitpoints and demands keen attention. But it has great damage potential.
It is possible to solo, but I recommend a party unless you have more than average experience with archers.
In a high magic setting you can cover that weakness with items.

Edit: The AB of 53 is better than most Weaponmasters.

posts.author: VXer
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: What could possibly go wrong with a divine archer? That type of damage isn't resisted anywhere & as long as you stay on top of your game you are gonna punch holes everywhere...
I think your "holy elven archer" is a bit better overall though, so, I would go with that, maybe with some more hit points though to avoid instant death from multiple greater ruins & Igms spam, don't know if they use Tony's A.I there.
Unless someone with greater experience on BSK can comment, I don't think it's fair to assume Divine Damage is not resisted in some shape or form. I personally haven't gotten that far yet where it becomes a problem with a Champion of Torm build, though I've only recently hit level 15. I have seen a Paladin 9/Wizard 1/Arcane Archer 30 build online so I believe a Divine Archer can be successful. However I'm not sure to what extent that is the build or the item quality on BSK. 

End-game gear can look like +10 Enhancement, 2d12 Magical, Massive Criticals 2d12, Keen, etc. How much of that archer's performance is the server-specific item quality and how much is the Divine Might damage it's hard to say without something empirical. 

Keen to see the outcome though.
